intro: Glochidion brothersonii, commonly known as the Malayan glabrous hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, often succulent leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually ovate to elliptic in shape and have a glossy appearance. Glochidion brothersonii is often found in tropical rainforests and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
